marklogic.body: Jordan Bastian own words said it all: Abreu, 38, another the left-handed-hitting whom over the past 2 years has hit .254 with a .353 on-base percentage and an average of 14 homers and 69 RBIs per season. He also WAS once an annual threat to top 20 home runs and 100 RBIs, but THOSE DAYS APPEAR TO BE IN THE PAST for the former slugger. Abreu has NOT COLLECTED at least 100 RBIs SINCE the 2009 season and he has not topped 20 homers since 2005. He has spent 16 season in the Majors between stints with the Astros, Phillies, Yankees and Angels. Then, i have a question that makes me angry. Why the hell Cleveland Indians is usual & customary purchase players who are only left in their tank the memories of glorious days gone by: Steve Carlton, Jack Morris, Jack McDowell, Mark Langston, among others. (The Tribe lacked only hire a down at heel Willie Mays in his last days when he was not the shadow of the superstar of the past.) This could be one reason why we have spent years waiting for the much coveted championship and only the Chicago Cubs surpass us in this sad achievement. So why go now after a discarded & Burned rocket as Bobby Abreu has its days numbered instead of getting young and talented players? We have to think about building a long term winning team. Yes, unfortunately I have to resort to the example of my hated NY Zebras: them, again and again, have managed to build teams that become dynasties very difficult to get Off the top & the gold. Got it Shapiro, Antonelli & Philosopher Smurf Manny?
